message.content:
We start by extracting the relevant figures from the balance sheet and cash flow statement.

Step 1. Calculate Debt to Asset Ratio

• From the balance sheet the “Total Liabilities” are given by “Total Current Liabilities” which is  
  3143833.89  
• The “Total Assets” (end amount) is  
  33082821.36  
• The Debt to Asset Ratio is calculated as:  
  Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
  = 3143833.89 / 33082821.36  
  ≈ 0.0951  
Rounded to two decimal places, this ratio is 0.10.

Step 2. Calculate “Net Cash Ratio”

(Note: The sample problem’s second ratio was computed as the Operating Cash Flow to Net Profit Ratio. In our case we follow that same method.)

• From the cash flow statement, the “Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities” is  
  -16772398.72  
• From the income statement, the “Net Profit” is  
  1938987.47  
• The ratio is computed as:  
  Net Cash Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit  
  = (-16772398.72) / 1938987.47  
  ≈ -8.65

Thus, our two computed ratios are:

• Debt to Asset Ratio: 0.10  
• Net Cash Ratio: -8.65

We now present the answer in the required json format.

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.10",
    "Net Cash Ratio": "-8.65"
  }
}
